word: burning the candle at both ends

meanings.meaning_en_US: To overwork oneself by doing too much in too little time.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在短時間內做太多而使自己過度工作

examples.sentence: He has been [burning the candle at both ends] with his work schedule.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的工作時間表使他過度工作。

examples.sentence: Students often [burn the candle at both ends] during finals week.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 學生們在期末考試周時經常過度工作。

examples.sentence: If you keep [burning the candle at both ends], you'll burn out quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你繼續過度工作，會很快筋疲力盡。

word: can’t judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Remember, you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，你不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: Many people forget that you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 許多人忘記了不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s important to remember that you can’t [judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物是很重要的。

word: can’t make heads or tails of it

meanings.meaning_en_US: To be unable to understand something.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 無法理解某事

examples.sentence: I can’t [make heads or tails of it] after reading the instructions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在看完指示後，我無法理解它。

examples.sentence: He was confused and couldn’t [make heads or tails of it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他感到困惑，無法理解它。

examples.sentence: When I listen to her explanations, I can’t [make heads or tails of it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 當我聽她的解釋時，我無法理解它。

word: don’t judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Always remember, [don’t judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 永遠記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s essential to [not judge a book by its cover] when meeting new people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在認識新朋友時，重要的是不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: In life, you should [not judge a book by its cover] too quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你不應該過快根據外表來判斷事物。

word: every cloud has a silver lining

meanings.meaning_en_US: Every negative situation has a positive aspect or outcome.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 每個消極的情況都有積極的方面或結果

examples.sentence: Even when things go wrong, [every cloud has a silver lining].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 即使事情走向錯誤，每個消極的情況都有積極的方面或結果。

examples.sentence: She always reminds herself that [every cloud has a silver lining].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是提醒自己每個消極的情況都有積極的方面。

examples.sentence: He believes that [every cloud has a silver lining] during tough times.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在艱難時期，他相信每個消極的情況都有積極的方面。

word: give credit where credit is due

meanings.meaning_en_US: To acknowledge and appreciate someone's contributions or achievements.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 承認並讚賞某人的貢獻或成就

examples.sentence: You should [give credit where credit is due] to your team for the project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你應該承認並讚賞你團隊在這個項目中的貢獻。

examples.sentence: Always [give credit where credit is due], especially in teamwork.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在團隊合作中，永遠要承認並讚賞別人的貢獻。

examples.sentence: It's crucial to [give credit where credit is due] in any organization.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在任何組織中，承認並讚賞某人的貢獻是很重要的。

word: half a loaf is better than none

meanings.meaning_en_US: It's better to have a partial advantage than to have nothing at all.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 擁有部分的好處勝過一無所有

examples.sentence: While it's not perfect, [half a loaf is better than none] in this situation.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 雖然這不是完美的，但在這種情況下，部分的好處勝過一無所有。

examples.sentence: [Half a loaf is better than none], so accept what you can get.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 部分的好處勝過一無所有，所以接受你能得到的。

examples.sentence: In tough times, [half a loaf is better than none] should be your goal.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在困難的時期，部分的好處勝過一無所有應該是你的目標。

word: if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it

meanings.meaning_en_US: If something is functioning well, there is no need to change it.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 如果某事運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它

examples.sentence: The software is running perfectly; [if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這個軟體運行得很好；如果它運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它。

examples.sentence: Our current strategy is successful; [if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我們目前的策略很成功；如果它運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它。

examples.sentence: [If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it] should apply to our processes.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果某事運行良好，就沒有必要去改變它應該適用於我們的流程。

word: never judge a book by its cover

meanings.meaning_en_US: One should not judge something based solely on its appearance.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物

examples.sentence: Always remember, [never judge a book by its cover].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 永遠記住，不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: It’s essential to [never judge a book by its cover] when meeting new people.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在認識新朋友時，重要的是不應該僅根據外表來判斷事物。

examples.sentence: In life, you should [never judge a book by its cover] too quickly.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，你不應該過快根據外表來判斷事物。

word: put all your eggs in one basket

meanings.meaning_en_US: To risk everything on a single venture.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 在單一項目上冒險一切

examples.sentence: Investing all your money in one stock means you’re [putting all your eggs in one basket].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 把所有的錢都投資在一支股票上意味著你在單一項目上冒險一切。

examples.sentence: She decided to [put all her eggs in one basket] by starting a single business.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她決定創辦一家公司，因為這是她的唯一選擇。

examples.sentence: You should be careful not to [put all your eggs in one basket] when investing.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在投資時，你應該小心不要在單一項目上冒險一切。

synonyms: don't put all your resources in one place

word: straight from the horse’s mouth

meanings.meaning_en_US: Information that comes directly from the source.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 直接來自來源的信息

examples.sentence: I heard it [straight from the horse’s mouth] that they are closing the office.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 我直接聽到消息說他們要關閉辦公室。

examples.sentence: When it comes to news, I prefer to get it [straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在新聞方面，我更喜歡直接來自來源的信息。

examples.sentence: She always shares what she knows [straight from the horse’s mouth].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她總是直接分享她所知道的消息。

word: the early bird catches the worm

meanings.meaning_en_US: Those who take action early will gain a reward.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 及早行動的人將會獲得回報

examples.sentence: If you want to secure a good job, remember that [the early bird catches the worm].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想獲得一份好工作，記住及早行動的人將會獲得回報。

examples.sentence: They always say [the early bird catches the worm] when it comes to opportunities.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 每當面對機會時，他們總是這麼說：及早行動的人將會獲得回報。

examples.sentence: In business, [the early bird catches the worm] is often true.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，及早行動的人將會獲得回報這通常是對的。

word: a leopard can’t change its spots

meanings.meaning_en_US: People cannot change their inherent nature.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人無法改變他們天生的性格

examples.sentence: You can't expect him to behave differently; [a leopard can’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 你不能期望他有所改變；人無法改變他們天生的性格。

examples.sentence: [A leopard can’t change its spots], so don’t be surprised by his actions.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 人無法改變他們天生的性格，所以對他的行為不要感到驚訝。

examples.sentence: No matter how hard he tries, [a leopard can’t change its spots].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 不管他多麼努力，人無法改變他們天生的性格。
others: no one is fixed in nature

word: all dressed up and nowhere to go

meanings.meaning_en_US: Prepared and ready but with no opportunity to act.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 準備好但卻沒有行動的機會

examples.sentence: She felt [all dressed up and nowhere to go] during the lockdown.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在禁足期間，她感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會。

examples.sentence: With the event canceled, he was [all dressed up and nowhere to go].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為活動取消，他感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會。

examples.sentence: Being [all dressed up and nowhere to go] made her feel frustrated.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 感到準備好但卻沒有行動的機會讓她感到沮喪。

word: cleanliness is next to godliness

meanings.meaning_en_US: Being clean is a virtue and reflects one's character.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格

examples.sentence: She believes that [cleanliness is next to godliness] in every aspect of life.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她相信潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格，適用於生活的各個方面。

examples.sentence: In our family, [cleanliness is next to godliness] is held as an important principle.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在我們家，潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格，是一個重要的原則。

examples.sentence: He was taught that [cleanliness is next to godliness] from a young age.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他從小就被教導潔淨是一種美德，反映出一個人的性格。

word: don’t let the cat out of the bag

meanings.meaning_en_US: To keep a secret or not to reveal information.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 保密或不透露信息

examples.sentence: Please don’t [let the cat out of the bag] about the surprise party.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 請不要透露關於驚喜派對的消息。

examples.sentence: He accidentally [let the cat out of the bag] during the discussion.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他在討論中不小心透露了消息。

examples.sentence: Make sure to [not let the cat out of the bag] until it’s time.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 確保不要在時間來臨之前透露消息。

word: don’t throw good money after bad

meanings.meaning_en_US: Do not continue to invest in a losing endeavor.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 不要繼續在失敗的事業上投入資金

examples.sentence: It's better to cut your losses than to [throw good money after bad].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 與其在失敗的事業上浪費金錢，不如減少損失更好。

examples.sentence: He realized he shouldn’t [throw good money after bad] trying to save that project.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他意識到不應該在試圖挽救那個項目時再投入資金。

examples.sentence: In business, you shouldn’t [throw good money after bad] if something clearly isn't working.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在商業中，如果某事明顯不起作用，你不應該繼續投入資金。

word: keep your nose to the grindstone

meanings.meaning_en_US: To work hard and diligently.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 努力且勤奮地工作

examples.sentence: If you want to succeed, you’ll need to [keep your nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 如果你想成功，你需要努力且勤奮地工作。

examples.sentence: He believes that [keeping your nose to the grindstone] leads to success.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他相信努力且勤奮地工作會帶來成功。

examples.sentence: To reach her goals, she knows she must [keep her nose to the grindstone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 為了達成她的目標，她知道自己必須努力且勤奮地工作。

word: man does not live by bread alone

meanings.meaning_en_US: People need more than just basic necessities to be fulfilled.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 人們需要的不僅僅是基本需求才能得到滿足

examples.sentence: In life, [man does not live by bread alone]; we need love and companionship.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 在生活中，人們需要的不僅僅是基本需求才能得到滿足；我們需要愛和伴侶。

examples.sentence: [Man does not live by bread alone] because spiritual fulfillment is also essential.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 因為靈性滿足也是必需的，人們不僅僅依賴於基本需求。

examples.sentence: The saying reminds us that [man does not live by bread alone].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這句話提醒我們，單靠基本需求並不足以滿足生活。

word: the best things in life are free

meanings.meaning_en_US: The most valuable experiences and moments cannot be bought.
meanings.meaning_zh_TW: 最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買
wrong_meaning_zh_TW: 所有價值都應用錢衡量

examples.sentence: She often says that [the best things in life are free].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 她常說，最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買。

examples.sentence: His memories confirm that [the best things in life are free].
examples.translation_zh_TW: 他的記憶證明了最珍貴的經歷和時刻無法用金錢購買。

examples.sentence: [The best things in life are free] is a reminder to value experiences over wealth.
examples.translation_zh_TW: 這句話提醒我們珍惜經歷勝於金錢。
